comments.body: Nathan Test Here are some segments, yo [attached Pet Rock, "Good morning. In less than an hour, aircraft from here will join others from around the world. And you will be launching the largest aerial battle in this history of mankind., mouse.png]

attachments.name: "Good morning. In less than an hour, aircraft from here will join others from around the world. And you will be launching the largest aerial battle in this history of mankind.
attachments.text:
"Good morning. In less than an hour, aircraft from here will join others from around the world. And you will be launching the largest aerial battle in this history of mankind.

Mankind -- that word should have new meaning for all of us today.

We can't be consumed by our petty differences anymore.

We will be united in our common interests.


Perhaps its fate that today is the 4th of July, and you will once again be fighting for our freedom, not from tyranny, oppression, or persecution -- but from annihilation.

We're fighting for our right to live, to exist.

And should we win the day, the 4th of July will no longer be known as an American holiday, but as the day when the world declared in one voice:

"We will not go quietly into the night!

We will not vanish without a fight!

We're going to live on!

We're going to survive!"

Today, we celebrate our Independence Day!"

â€” President of the United States of America

notes.text:
Welcome to Notes

Use Notes to capture meeting minutes, thoughts, ideas - just about anything - and share them with people you're working with.

â€¢ Notes are private until you attach them to something.
â€¢ To attach a note just click the paperclip icon in the upper right corner.
â€¢ You can even create tasks from a note (Web app only). Try it now - highlight some text and click "Create Task"â€¦

Don't worry about saving your notes, that happens automatically. Once you write a note it's available wherever you are - on the Web, on your tablet and on your phone (you do have the mobile app, don't you?).

Recipe for something awesome 

Preheat oven to 425 degrees.

Lay the puff pastry on a parchment paper lined sheet pan. If the pastry has creases in it, roll a rolling pin over it to flatten it out slightly. Cut a large disk from the pastry (it will be about 9 â€“ 10 inch in diameter) using a dinner plate for a pattern. Prick the surface all over with a fork, well.

Bake for 15 to 20 minutes till golden brown on top. Set aside.

Meanwhile, cut each apple into 8 wedges. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add apples and cook, stirring occasionally 10 minutes or until apples begin to soften. Reduce heat to low and cook an additional 5 minutes or until apples are cooked through. Remove apples from skillet and set aside.

Add the cinnamon and caramels to skillet and melt over low heat, stirring frequently for 5 minutes. Return apples to skillet and fold them into the melted caramel.

Spoon the warm apple mixture over cooked pastry. Tart is best when served the same day.
